[[Western Maryland]] | branding = ''"West Virginia Public Radio"'' | slogan = | airdate = [[1997 in radio|1997]] | frequency = 89.5 [[Megahertz|MHz]] | format = [[Public Radio]] | power = 10,000 [[Watt]]s | erp = | haat = 321.9 Meters | class = B | facility_id = 71659 | coordinates = {{Coord|39|12|7.0|N|79|16|31.0|W|type:landmark}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = West Virginia Educational Broadcasting Authority | licensee = | sister_stations = | webcast = [http://wvpbmedia.com/radio/listen.pls WAUA Webstream] | website = [http://www.wvpubcast.org/ WAUA Online] | affiliations = [[National Public Radio]]
[[Public Radio International]] }} '''WAUA''' is a [[Public Radio]] formatted [[Broadcasting|broadcast]] [[radio station]] licensed to [[Petersburg, West Virginia]], serving the Potomac Highlands of West Virginia and Western Maryland. WAUA is owned and operated by West Virginia Educational Broadcasting Authority. ==External links== * [http://www.wvpubcast.org/ West Virginia Public Radio Online] * {{FM station data|WAUA}} {{NPR West Virginia}} {{Cumberland Radio}} [[Category:Radio stations in West Virginia|AUA]] [[Category:National Public Radio member stations]] {{WestVirginia-radio-station-stub}}
